abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Mali Economic Policy and
            Public Finance Management Credit (EPPFMC) Project were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: for a country
            such as Mali with weak institutional and administrative
            capacities, it is important to be realistic on what can be
            achieved, and be selective on the issues to be undertaken
            within a short timeframe; the operation demonstrated the
            merits of including in Mali's policy-based lending
            operations, policy and institutional reforms measures
            complementary to and supportive of ongoing sector
            operations; it is important to develop a complete
            M&E/Results framework to enable clear assessment of
            program outcomes; and finally, policy measures should be
            better matched to the objectives sought.
